bibl.title: Νεῖλος: El nom grec del riu Nil pot ser d'origen amazic? [Νεῖλος: le nom grec du fleuve Nil peut-il être d'origine amazigh?] Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Since no convincing Greek, Egyptian nor Semitic etymology has yet been proposed for the Greek name of the river Nile, a possible Libyan link with a word λιλυ attested by lexicographer Hesychius of Alexandria (τὸ ὕδωρ, Λίβυες) is discussed from phonetic, morphological, semantic and contextual points of view. The word λιλυ in the language of the Libyans is still in use in quite a few Amazigh dialects as ilel, not meaning 'water' but 'sea' or 'great aquiferous surface'.
